'''Norman Davis''' ([[16 May]] [[1913]] â€“ [[2 December]] [[1989]])  was a New Zealand-born scholar. He succeeded [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] as Professor of English Language and Literature at [[Merton College]], [[University of Oxford|Oxford]], a post he held until his retirement in 1980.
